pageProps.body:
Queue

queue theory

  • performance evaluation

    • λ\lambdaλ average arrival rate, packets per second
    • μ\muμ average service rate, packets servered per second
    • ccc number of servers
    • ρ=λ/cμ\rho = \lambda/c\muρ=λ/cμ traffic congestion in servers
      • if >1 averge exceeds service capability
      • if = 1 randomness prevents queue from emptying
    • pnp_npn​ is probability of a particular number n customers in the system
    • expected number in system: L=∑(npn)L = \sum(n p_n)L=∑(npn​)
    • expected number in queue: L=∑n=c+1((n−c)pn)L = \sum_{n=c+1}((n-c) p_n)L=∑n=c+1​((n−c)pn​)
    • time : T=Tq+ST = T_q + ST=Tq​+S time in queue + service time
    • little law
      • W=E[T]Wq=E[Tq]W = E[T] W_q = E[T_q]W=E[T]Wq​=E[Tq​] mean waiting time in system
      • L=λWL = \lambda WL=λW
      • E[T]=E[Tq]+E[S]E[T] = E[T_q] + E[S]E[T]=E[Tq​]+E[S] to get W=Wq+1/μW = W_q + 1/\muW=Wq​+1/μ
      • expected servered people: E[Ns]=L−Lq=λ(W−Wq)=λ(1/μ)=λ/μE[N_s] = L-L_q = \lambda(W-W_q) = \lambda(1/\mu) = \lambda/\muE[Ns​]=L−Lq​=λ(W−Wq​)=λ(1/μ)=λ/μ
      • c=1,r=ρ,L−Lq=∑n=1np−∑n=1(n−1)p=∑n=1pn=1−p0=ρc = 1, r = \rho , L-L_q = \sum_{n=1} np- \sum_{n=1} (n-1)p = \sum_{n=1} p_n = 1-p_0=\rhoc=1,r=ρ,L−Lq​=∑n=1​np−∑n=1​(n−1)p=∑n=1​pn​=1−p0​=ρ
    • busy probability
      • for G/G/c system, E[Ns]=rE[N_s] = rE[Ns​]=r
      • Pb=ρP_b = \rhoPb​=ρ one server being busy brobability
      • ...

  • rate transition diagrams

    • a type of continuous-time Markov chain
    • (λn+μn)pn=(λn−1+μn−1)pn−1+(λn+1+μn+1)pn+1(\lambda_n+\mu_n)p_n =(\lambda_{n-1}+\mu_{n-1})p_{n-1}+(\lambda_{n+1}+\mu_{n+1})p_{n+1}(λn​+μn​)pn​=(λn−1​+μn−1​)pn−1​+(λn+1​+μn+1​)pn+1​
    • $p_3 = \frac{\lambda_2 \lambda_1 \lambda_0}{\mu_3 \mu_2 \mu_1} p_0 $
    • pn=∏i=1nλi−1μip_n = \prod_{i=1}^n\frac{\lambda_{i-1}}{\mu_i}pn​=∏i=1n​μi​λi−1​​

  • M/M/1 system

    • Exponentially distributed
      • interarrival time TI(t)=λe−λtTI(t)=\lambda e^{-\lambda t}TI(t)=λe−λt
      • service time TI(t)=μe−μtTI(t)=\mu e^{-\mu t}TI(t)=μe−μt
    • if all μ\muμ and λ\lambdaλ equal get pn=p0(λμ)np_n = p_0 (\frac{\lambda}{\mu})^npn​=p0​(μλ​)n
    • p0=1−ρp_0 = 1-\rhop0​=1−ρ - > pn=(1−ρ)ρnp_n = (1-\rho)\rho^npn​=(1−ρ)ρn
